title: Exiled Chinese Businessman Guo Wengui Abandons Bankruptcy Case
sub_head: Guo Wengui asked to dismiss his chapter 11 petition, short on funding for mounting legal bills
body:
Exiled Chinese businessman Guo Wengui abandoned his personal bankruptcy case, saying he can’t afford the mounting costs of using chapter 11 to fight litigation from his largest creditor.
Mr. Guo, also known by the name Kwok Ho Wan, asked in court papers Wednesday to dismiss his bankruptcy case, saying it is “buckling under the weight” of the professional fees racked up during “unrestrained legal warfare” with his longtime legal foe, Pacific Alliance Asia Opportunity Fund LP.
